text: Idea for CM: Add the option to populate a choice field with a HubL var (even if it's defined in the template environment instead inside the CM, that should not be a problem because I can read template vars already in the CM)

while I get where you’re coming from, I don’t think this will be high on their priority list, It could cause some issues, (for example, if that variable is not called on a page but someone adds the module there) - now the module breaks.
what I do think they’d be okay with creating however is a way to pull choices from a hubDB.

I know it is not a priority and it will mean a module is not independent (or "enclose") as they are moving to, but enclosing a module 100% erasing dependencies will set a scenario really limited for customizations :disappointed:

I think that the issue you show is pretty easy to manage: if no var to populate from the choice field will be empty. Of course the CM wont work property but is up to you add a case "empty", false or something like that to display a: "remember to populate the var myChoices". that is not a big deal.
And with this capabilities you can populate a choice with hubDB too so all benefit :wink:
well. I agree with you. It would be a nice thing to be able to do.
actually you can do that already if you put the choice field with the options you like out of the CM, but it's a headache.
Thats why I was thinking it would be much better to manage and I won't think in this kind of special CM to sell on the market but for real projects where is needed
